meanings.definition: To eject saliva or mucus from the mouth or throat by coughing or spitting.
meanings.sent1: After catching a cold, he was expectorating mucus to clear his throat.
meanings.sent2: The doctor advised the patient to avoid expectorating in public places to prevent the spread of germs.
meanings.sent3: She found herself expectorating into a tissue during the comedy show, causing a few chuckles around her.
meanings.sent4: The old machine was expectorating smoke like a tired dragon, signaling it was time for repairs.
meanings.sent5: The image of the cat expectorating a hairball was both amusing and slightly gross.

meanings.definition: To expel phlegm or other matter from the throat or lungs by coughing and spitting.
meanings.sent1: The sick child was expectorating phlegm into a tissue to feel better.
meanings.sent2: In the quiet library, the sound of someone expectorating loudly was quite disruptive.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about expectorating phlegm as a unique talent in his stand-up routine.
meanings.sent4: The volcano was expectorating lava with such force that it lit up the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The image of the old man expectorating phlegm into a bucket was not a pleasant sight.
